comments.author: mozilla@virginmedia.com
comments.creator: mozilla@virginmedia.com
comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:6.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/6.0
Build ID: 20110811165603

Steps to reproduce:

Create a prefwindow (or any window?) dialog without an id attribute (since there isn't really any use for one).  Then call opendialog, or open it through the addon manager.


Actual results:

Several "Empty string passed to getElementById()" messages appear in the console.  Then some more appear every time it gains focus.


Expected results:

No messages would be better, since the dialog works perfectly.  Or a message indicating the actual error if there is some internal need for the window to have an id.

comments.author: fmdevelopertim@gmail.com
comments.creator: fmdevelopertim@gmail.com
comments.raw_text: Can you provide a public URL or reduced test case that exhibits this issue.
comments.text: Can you provide a public URL or reduced test case that exhibits this issue.

comments.author: mozilla@virginmedia.com
comments.creator: mozilla@virginmedia.com
comments.text:
Public URL no, but if you install v0.1.6 of this extension, the options dialog throws the error:
https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/utorrent-status-tool/

Removing the entire contents of the dialog, the errors remain.  Adding an id to the prefwindow the errors disappear.

I found a note on an MDN page that this occurs also with XUL window elements, although I haven't tested this:
https://developer.mozilla.org/en/XUL/Attribute/id
comments.raw_text:

comments.creator: mark.yen@suse.com
comments.author: mark.yen@suse.com
comments.raw_text:
Steps to reproduce:
1) Open up scratch pad (Shift+F4)
2) in the menu, Environment -> Browser
3) Enter the following javascript (all on one line, it's a long string):

openDialog('data:application/vnd.mozilla.xul+xml,<?xml-stylesheet href="chrome://global/skin/global.css"?><prefwindow xmlns="http://www.mozilla.org/keymaster/gatekeeper/there.is.only.xul"/>')

4) In the menu, Execute -> Run
5) Unfocus the window
6) Focus the window

Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:6.0.2) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/6.0.2

comments.author: ioana_damy@yahoo.com
comments.creator: ioana_damy@yahoo.com

comments.raw_text: The "Empty string..." message is displayed as a warning in the Browser Console. It's also only displayed once, with it being marked that is has been generated 10 times. Given this is just a warning, it makes sense the dialog works.
comments.text: The "Empty string..." message is displayed as a warning in the Browser Console. It's also only displayed once, with it being marked that is has been generated 10 times. Given this is just a warning, it makes sense the dialog works.
